node.title: Jeff Bezos gives $100 million to the Obama Foundation.
node.alt: Jeff Bezos at the National Press Club in Washington in 2019. Since stepping down as chief executive of Amazon in July, Mr. Bezos has significantly raised his profile as a philanthropist.
node.description: The gift was the largest yet for the Obama Foundation and was one in a series of splashy donations by Mr. Bezos, one of the worldâ€™s richest men, in recent months.
node.content: ["Former President Barack Obama\u2019s private foundation announced on Monday that it had been promised a donation of $100 million from the Amazon founder Jeff Bezos.", "The gift, the largest yet for the Obama Foundation, was one in a series of splashy donations by Mr. Bezos, one of the world\u2019s richest men, in recent months. Last week, Mr. Bezos announced $96.2 million in grants to groups working to end family homelessness.", "Since stepping down as chief executive of Amazon in July, Mr. Bezos has significantly raised his profile as a philanthropist, in addition to traveling to space on a ship made by his rocket company, Blue Origin.", "In return for the donation, Mr. Bezos asked that a plaza at the Obama Presidential Center be named for the civil rights leader John Lewis, who died last year. The foundation broke ground on the center, which will include Mr. Obama\u2019s presidential library, a museum, an athletic center and more, earlier this year.", "\u201cFreedom fighters deserve a special place in the pantheon of heroes, and I can\u2019t think of a more fitting person to honor with this gift than John Lewis, a great American leader and a man of extraordinary decency and courage,\u201d Mr. Bezos said in a statement released by the Obama Foundation. \u201cI\u2019m thrilled to support President and Mrs. Obama and their foundation in its mission to train and inspire tomorrow\u2019s leaders.\u201d", "News of the gift was earlier reported by the online news group Puck.", "It was neither Mr. Bezos\u2019s biggest gift in recent months nor his first brush with Mr. Obama\u2019s orbit. In September, Mr. Bezos, standing alongside John Kerry, Mr. Obama\u2019s former Secretary of State, pledged $1 billion through his Bezos Earth Fund for conservation."]
